item.title: Report I-2024070153
item.description:
Report I-2024070153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: Auburn
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSS EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Ross dock employee was loading customer freight into a trailer and his forklift forks were not level wh^n setting up to put forklift forks into the wooden pallet with freight on it when forklift operator moved forward to go under the pallet the forks punctured the box/bag. The freight leaked on the trailer floor. The forklift operator then notified a supervisor and they determine what the freight was and then proceeded to contain the liquid by using speedy dry material to soak up the liquid. The cleanup was performed after it was deternmined what the proper HM clean up procedure needed to be followed to protect Ross employees. A dock employee then took the damaged box of NA1760 off the pallet in the trailer. The damaged- 1 box/1-5 gallon bag and cleaning materials used for cleanup were placed in a recovery drum for disposal.
